00080 #define OTAU_READ_EEPROM_OK         (0)
00081 #define OTAU_READ_EEPROM_FAILED     (-1)
00082 #define OTAU_EEPROM_BUSY            (-2)

00084 #define BOOT_IMAGETYPE_INTERNAL   0
00085 #define BOOT_IMAGETYPE_EXTERNAL   1

00087 #define BOOT_IMAGE_INACTIVE       0
00088 #define BOOT_IMAGE_ACTIVE         1

00090 #define OTAU_UPGRADE_PENDING_VALUE 0xA5
00091 /*
00092   From bootloader version > 3, Application boot information is located in last 256 bytes
00093   of internal flash(as also EEPROM) which will be used by bootloader for image upgrade
00094   OtauBootInfo_t structure will occupy 136 Bytes
00095   Additional 192 - 136 = 56 bytes are reseverd for future enhancements of OtauBootInfo_t
00096   Next two bytes are allocated for ImageType
00097   Next one byte is allocated for download complete flag,
00098   in case if any power cycle happens during integrity check
00099 */
00100 #define APP_BOOTINFO_TOTAL_SIZE               (256)  // Bytes
00101 /*Last ROW (256 Bytes) of EEPROM/FLASH */
00102 #define APP_BOOTINFO_EEPROM_OFFSET            (FLASH_TOTAL_SIZE - APP_BOOTINFO_TOTAL_SIZE - FLASH_EEPROM_BASE_ADDRESS)
00103 #define APP_BOOTINFO_MAX_SIZE                 (192) // (64Bytes in page * 3) 
00104 #define APP_BOOTINFO_RESERVERD_EEPROM_SIZE    (APP_BOOTINFO_MAX_SIZE - sizeof(OtauBootInfo_t))  // 160 - 136ytes are reserved
00105 /*last page of Last ROW*/
00106 #define APP_IMAGE_TYPE_EEPROM_OFFSET          (APP_BOOTINFO_EEPROM_OFFSET + APP_BOOTINFO_MAX_SIZE)
00107 #define APP_DOWNLOAD_COMPLETE_EEPROM_OFFSET   (APP_IMAGE_TYPE_EEPROM_OFFSET + sizeof(ZCL_OtauImageType_t))
00108 
00109 /*For bootloader version < 3*/
00110 #define OTAU_IMAGE_KEY_OFFSET                 (4)
00111 #define EEPROM_IMGTYPE_OFFSET                 (37U)
00112 #define EEPROM_IMGTYPE_LENGTH                 (2U)
00113 #define OTAU_FLASH_WRITE_SKIP_EEPROM_OFFSET   (EEPROM_IMGTYPE_OFFSET + EEPROM_IMGTYPE_LENGTH)
00114 #define OTAU_FLASH_WRITE_SKIP_EEPROM_LENGTH   (4U * 2)  // 4bytes each for start  address and end address
00115 #define OTAU_FLASH_WRITE_SKIP_WORDS_LENGTH    (2U)
00116 #define OTAU_EEPROM_ACTION_FLAG_OFFSET        (OTAU_FLASH_WRITE_SKIP_EEPROM_OFFSET + OTAU_FLASH_WRITE_SKIP_EEPROM_LENGTH)
00117 #define OTAU_EEEPROM_ACTION_FLAG_LENGTH       (1U)
00118 
00119 #define OTAU_UPGRADE_END_RESP_MAN_ID_WILDCARD_VAL   0xFFFF
00120 #define OTAU_UPGRADE_END_RESP_IMG_TYPE_WILDCARD_VAL 0xFFFF
00121 #define OTAU_UPGRADE_END_RESP_FW_VER_WILDCARD_VAL   0xFFFFFFFF
00122 
00123 #define AUXILIARY_STRUCTURE_IS_FULL          (sizeof(uint32_t) + sizeof(uint32_t)) //  offset + internalLength
00124 #define IMAGE_CRC_SIZE                       1
00125 
00126 /*
00127 OTAU header feilds length zcl spec rev 6 - 11.4.2 OTA Header Format
00128 */
00129 #define OTAUHDR_FILEID                    (0x0BEEF11E)
00130 #define OTAUHDR_MAJOR_VERSION             (0x01)
00131 #define OTAUHDR_MAJOR_VERSION_SHIFT       (8)
00132 #define OTAUHDR_FILEID_OCTETLEN           (4U)  // OTA upgrade file identifier
00133 #define OTAUHDR_HDRVERSION_OCTELEN        (2U)  // OTA Header version
00134 #define OTAUHDR_HDRLEN_OCTETLEN           (2U)  // OTA Header length
00135 #define OTAUHDR_HDR_FIELD_CTRL_OCTETLEN   (2U)  // OTA Header Field control
00136 #define OTAUHDR_MFG_CODE_OCTETLEN         (2U)  // Manufacturer code
00137 #define OTAUHDR_IMGTYPE_OCTETLEN          (2U)  // Image type
00138 #define OTAUHDR_FILE_VER_OCTETLEN         (4U)  // File version
00139 #define OTAUHDR_ZSTACK_VER_OCTETLEN       (2U)  // ZigBee Stack version
00140 #define OTAUHDR_HDR_STRING_OCTETLEN       (32U) // OTA Header string
00141 #define OTAUHDR_TOTAL_IMAGE_SIZE_OCTETLEN (4U)  // Total Image size (including header)
00142 
00143 #define OTAUHDR_SEC_CREDENTIAL_VER_LEN    (1U)  //Security credential version
00144 #define OTAUHDR_UPGRADE_DEST_ADDR_LEN     (8U)  // Upgrade file destination IEEE Address
00145 #define OTAUHDR_MIN_HW_VER_LEN            (2U)  // Minimum hardware version
00146 #define OTAUHDR_MAX_HW_VER_LEN            (2U)  // Maximum hardware version
00147 
00148 /*
00149 OTAU header feilds offset  zcl spec rev 6 - 11.4.2 OTA Header Format
00150 */
00151 
00152 #define OTAUHDR_FILEID_OFFSET               (0)  // OTA upgrade file identifier
00153 #define OTAUHDR_HDRVERSION_OFFSET           (OTAUHDR_FILEID_OFFSET          + OTAUHDR_FILEID_OCTETLEN)        // OTA Header version
00154 #define OTAUHDR_HDRLEN_OFFSET               (OTAUHDR_HDRVERSION_OFFSET      + OTAUHDR_HDRVERSION_OCTELEN)     // OTA Header length
00155 #define OTAUHDR_HDR_FIELD_CTRL_OFFSET       (OTAUHDR_HDRLEN_OFFSET          + OTAUHDR_HDRLEN_OCTETLEN)        // OTA Header Field control
00156 #define OTAUHDR_MFG_CODE_OFFSET             (OTAUHDR_HDR_FIELD_CTRL_OFFSET  + OTAUHDR_HDR_FIELD_CTRL_OCTETLEN)  // Manufacturer code
00157 #define OTAUHDR_IMGTYPE_OFFSET              (OTAUHDR_MFG_CODE_OFFSET        + OTAUHDR_MFG_CODE_OCTETLEN)      // Image type
00158 #define OTAUHDR_FILE_VER_OFFSET             (OTAUHDR_IMGTYPE_OFFSET         + OTAUHDR_IMGTYPE_OCTETLEN)       // File version
00159 #define OTAUHDR_ZSTACK_VER_OFFSET           (OTAUHDR_FILE_VER_OFFSET        + OTAUHDR_FILE_VER_OCTETLEN)      // ZigBee Stack version
00160 #define OTAUHDR_HDR_STRING_OFFSET           (OTAUHDR_ZSTACK_VER_OFFSET      + OTAUHDR_ZSTACK_VER_OCTETLEN)    // OTA Header string
00161 #define OTAUHDR_TOTAL_IMAGE_SIZE_OFFSET     (OTAUHDR_HDR_STRING_OFFSET      + OTAUHDR_HDR_STRING_OCTETLEN)    // Total Image size (including header)
00162 
00163 #define OTAUHDR_IMGTYPE_IMGENC_MASK                 (1 << 15)   //0x8000  
00164 #define OTAUHDR_IMGTYPE_INTCHKPRESENT_MASK          (1 << 14)   //0x4000
00165 #define OTAUHDR_IMGTYPE_ISINTCHKENC_MASK            (1 << 13)   //0x2000
00166 #define OTAUHDR_IMGTYPE_ISINTCHKOTHERTHANCRC_MASK   (1 << 12)   //0x1000
00167 #define OTAUHDR_IMGTYPE_MASK                        (0xf << 12) //0xF000
00168 
00169 #define OTAUHDR_IMGTYPE_ISIMGSEC_ENABLED(x)     (x & OTAUHDR_IMGTYPE_IMGENC_MASK)
00170 #define OTAUHDR_IMGTYPE_ISINTCHKPRESENT(x)      (x & OTAUHDR_IMGTYPE_INTCHKPRESENT_MASK)
00171 #define OTAUHDR_IMGTYPE_ISINTCHKENCRYPTED(x)    (x & OTAUHDR_IMGTYPE_ISINTCHKENC_MASK)
00172 #define OTAUHDR_IMGTYPE_ISINTCHKOTHERTHANCRC(x) (x & OTAUHDR_IMGTYPE_ISINTCHKOTHERTHANCRC_MASK)
00173 
00174 #define OTAU_SREC_DATA_LENGTH           16          // The conventional data field length in S-Record
00175 #define OTAU_MIC_BLOCK_COUNT            1
00176 #define OTAU_MIC_CRC_OFFSET             0
00177 #define OTAUHDR_INTEGRITYCODE_OCTETLEN  (16U)
00178 
00179 /* 
00180    Account for delay at server for ongoing transaction. Consider page processing
00181    at server as the longest transaction even if this client is in block mode.
00182    timeout ~= 3000 ms ~= (((pageSize/serverBlockRspPayloadSize)+1) * 
00183                            (respSpacing + ISDDelay))
00184    Considering, pageSize = 256, respSpacing = 200, serverBlockRspPayloadSize = 38,
00185    200 for server delay for read.
00186    Note : (1) This is just a guess at client side. If server is transacting page from 
00187           a client with much higher page size, this client's requests will have 
00188           frequent retry. (2) Assuming page parameters of server's ongoing transaction
00189           to be same as this client's page parameters is also not correct, so go for
00190           default value
00191 */
00192 #define OTAU_DEFAULT_RESPONSE_WAIT_TIMEOUT   3000ul
00193 
00194 #define OTAU_UPGRADE_END_RESP_MAN_ID_WILDCARD_VAL 0xFFFF
00195 #define OTAU_UPGRADE_END_RESP_IMG_TYPE_WILDCARD_VAL 0xFFFF
00196 #define OTAU_UPGRADE_END_RESP_FW_VER_WILDCARD_VAL 0xFFFFFFFF
00197 
00198 /* frequency of write(in bytes) = total-file-size/OTAU_NUM_OF_PDS_WRITES */
00199 #define OTAU_NUM_OF_PDS_WRITES               20 // (MAXIMUM 100)
00200 
00201 #define REPOST_OFD_ACTION                    10ul
00202 #define AMOUNT_MSEC_IN_SEC                   1000ul
00203 #define WAIT_FOR_RUN_UPGRADE_REQ             0xFF
00204 #define WAITING_UPGRADE_END_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT 1 * 60 * 60 * AMOUNT_MSEC_IN_SEC  // 1 hour (in msec)
00205 #define UNLIMITED_WAITING_TIME               0xFFFFFFFFul
00206 #define UPGRADE_END_REQ_QUICK_TIMEOUT        100

00262 typedef struct {
00263   ZclOtauDiscoveryResult_t addr;
00264   ZCL_OtauFirmwareVersion_t ver;
00265   uint8_t queryJitter;
00266 } ZclOtauImageNotifyParams_t;
00267 
00268 
00269 typedef struct {
00270   uint16_t  multiApps       :1;   //  BIT_0
00271   uint16_t  imgSecurity     :1;   //  BIT_1
00272   uint16_t  rfInterface     :1;   //  BIT_2
00273   uint16_t  usart0Interface :1;   //  BIT_3
00274   uint16_t  usart1Interface :1;   //  BIT_4
00275   uint16_t  spiInterface    :1;   //  BIT_5
00276   uint16_t  twiInterface    :1;   //  BIT_6
00277   uint16_t  usbInterface    :1;   //  BIT_7
00278   uint16_t  reserved        :8;   //  BIT_8 - BIT_16
00279 } featureBits_t;
00280 
00281 typedef union {
00282   uint16_t        mask;
00283   featureBits_t   bits;
00284 } FeatureMask_t;
00285 
00286 typedef struct 
00287 {
00288   /*
00289     Whether the Existing image is in internal or external
00290       0 - Internal
00291       1 - External
00292   */
00293   uint16_t   memtype:1;
00294   /*
00295     Whether the Existing image is active or not
00296       0 - In Active
00297       1 - Active
00298   */
00299   uint16_t   active:1; 
00300   uint16_t   reserved2:6;         // Place-holder
00301 }ExistingImageInfo_t;
00302 
00303 typedef struct 
00304 {
00305   /*
00306     updatePending  - 0 No image upgrade
00307                      1 Image upgrade pending
00308   */
00309   uint16_t   updatePending:1;
00310   /*
00311     Whether the downloaded image is in internal or external
00312       0 - Internal
00313       1 - External
00314   */
00315   uint16_t   srcMemType:1;
00316   /*
00317     Whether the destination memory is internal or external
00318       0 - Internal
00319       1 - External
00320   */
00321   uint16_t   destMemType:1;
00322   /*
00323     Type of the downloaded image:
00324     Img_type:   00- Application
00325                 01- Secured application
00326                 02- Non Application
00327   */
00328   uint16_t   imageType:2;
00329   uint16_t   reserved:3;  // Place-holder
00330 }BootInfo_t;
00331 
00332 // App-specific fields in APP_INFO
00333 typedef struct app_table_tag {
00334   char applicationName[16];       // Description string for the app
00335   uint32_t  appStartAddr;         // Start address of the app image
00336   uint32_t  appSize;              // Size of the current app image
00337   uint32_t  srcAddress;           // Address where the image is downloaded
00338   uint32_t  dstAddress;           // Address where the image should be placed at the end of upgrade
00339   uint32_t  skipStartAddress;     // Start address of the location to be skipped 
00340   uint32_t  skipEndAddress;       // End address of the location to be skipped
00341   uint32_t  imageSize;            // Size of the image to be upgraded
00342   ExistingImageInfo_t existingImageInfo;  // 2 Bytes flag to indicate information abt existing image
00343   BootInfo_t bootImageInfo;       // 2 bytes flag  to indicate the new image information 
00344   uint8_t   imageSecureKey[OTAUHDR_INTEGRITYCODE_OCTETLEN];  // 16 byte security key to decrypt image after download  
00345 } AppInfo_t;
00346 
00347 // APP_INFO table 
00348 typedef struct {
00349   uint8_t         crc;                   // CRC over the entire app-info (excluding this field)
00350   /*
00351   Specifies default application index for the bootloader to jump to, 
00352   if the Active fields in application-related fields are in inconsistent state 
00353   (e.g. all set as non-active).
00354   */
00355   uint8_t         defaultApp;
00356   
00357   /*Application-configurable bit-mask indicating enabled bootloader features and interfaces:
00358   uint16_t  multiApps       :1;   //  BIT_0
00359   uint16_t  imgSecurity     :1;   //  BIT_1
00360   uint16_t  rfInterface     :1;   //  BIT_2
00361   uint16_t  usart0Interface :1;   //  BIT_3
00362   uint16_t  usart1Interface :1;   //  BIT_4
00363   uint16_t  spiInterface    :1;   //  BIT_5
00364   uint16_t  twiInterface    :1;   //  BIT_6
00365   uint16_t  usbInterface    :1;   //  BIT_7
00366   uint16_t  reserved        :8;   //  BIT_8 to BIT_15
00367   */
00368   FeatureMask_t   features;         // Bit-mask for features requested by app (See boot_version.h for bit positions) 
00369   uint8_t         noOfApplications; // Number of valid applications in internal flash. Shall be at least 1.  
00370   AppInfo_t       appTable[2];      // App-specific sub-table for each app (upto 2)
00371 } OtauBootInfo_t;
00372 
00373 /* Bootloader information is available @200 location.
00374 */
00375 typedef struct {
00376   uint8_t         crc;
00377   uint16_t        majorRev;     // Major revision of the bootloader release
00378   uint16_t        minorRev;     // Minor revision of the bootloader release
00379   uint16_t        reservedRev;  // Reserved for extending revision  
00380   FeatureMask_t   supported_features;  // Bit-mask indicating available features
00381   uint32_t        start_address;  // Start address of the bootloader in internal flash
00382   uint8_t         mcu_flash_size; // Flash size of the internal MCU (2^value KB, if non-zero) 
00383   uint8_t         ext_flash_size; // Flash size of the external mem (2^value KB, if non-zero)
00384   uint8_t         bprot_size;     // Size of the BOOT_PROT region (2^value KB, if non-zero)
00385   uint8_t         reserved;       // Future extension
00386 } BootLoaderInfo_t;
